duties_responsibilities.duty: Coordinate and execute testing of finished product, growth promotion, bioburden, endotoxin, TOC/conductivity, and environmental monitoring.
Perform routine analysis on finished product and raw material testing according to established specifications and procedures.
Conduct investigations including sterility assurance and environmental monitoring.
Support sampling and conduct microbiological testing on facility water (WFI).
Review and approve data related to sterility, endotoxin, TOC/conductivity, bioburden, and chemistry testing on finished product and/or raw materials.
Author quality systems documents, review batch records, and prepare certification of compliance for customers.
Contribute to maintaining calibration status of all laboratory equipment.
Train on GDP, GLP, GMP, aseptic technique, and sampling for environmental monitoring.
Perform technical review of test results to ensure completeness and compliance with GMP.
Assist with the maintenance and trending of quality and environmental data.
Maintain laboratory cleanliness and inventory of microbiology/laboratory supplies.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Microbiology, Biology, or related scientific discipline.
1 year experience in a microbiology laboratory, pharmaceutical industry, or medical device.
Solid foundational knowledge of microbiology with relation to performing environmental monitoring and completing investigations.
